lead_paragraph: DEAR DIARY: One reason many dyed-in-the-wool New Yorkers love living in the city so much is that not a day goes by without an encounter with something or someone surprising. Earlier this year, I was heading home on Carmine Street in Greenwich Village when I saw an unfamiliar woman who seemed to be heading straight toward me. She looked to be in her mid-30's and a cut above the typical bag lady. It quickly became clear that she wanted something from me and as she came closer, I held up my hand, palm out, and shook my head as if to say ''Sorry, but I have nothing to give you.''
